sep.gaia.resources.tiles2d

Class Style

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.tiles2d.Style

  • public class Style
extends java.lang.Object
    TileResource objects gets their content by openstreetmap.org tile servers. There are many different server with different styled tiles. To change these styles in GAIA, the user can specify which style he wants to see. Every style has its Style object, so the TileManager can make a difference. Each style has on source where it's been loaded. This URL or list of URLs are specified here, too.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer, Matthias Fisch

    • Constructor Detail

      • Style

        public Style(java.lang.String label,
     java.util.List<Style.SubServer> subServers,
     java.lang.String syntax)
        Constructor defines the list of subservers and the label, as well as the syntax to be used when generating URLs. The label is also used by the TileManager for making directories when caching the TileResource objects on HDD.
        Parameters:
        label - The human-friendly name of the style.
        subServers - The list of hostnames on which the tile server can be contacted.
        syntax - The syntax-string to be used when generating a URL. Valid parameters are:
        • $s: The name of the subserver.
        • $z: The zoomlevel.
        • $x: The x-coordinate of the tiles.
        • $y: The y-coordinate of the tiles.

      • Style

        public Style(java.lang.String label,
     java.util.List<Style.SubServer> subServers,
     java.lang.String syntax,
     int minZoom,
     int maxZoom)
        Constructor defines the list of subservers and the label, as well as the syntax to be used when generating URLs. The label is also used by the TileManager for making directories when caching the TileResource objects on HDD.
        Parameters:
        label - The human-friendly name of the style.
        subServers - The list of hostnames on which the tile server can be contacted.
        syntax - The syntax-string to be used when generating a URL. Valid parameters are:
        • $s: The name of the subserver.
        • $z: The zoomlevel.
        • $x: The x-coordinate of the tiles.
        • $y: The y-coordinate of the tiles.
        minZoom - The minimum zoom provided for this style.
        maxZoom - The maximum zoom provided for this style.

      • generateUrl

        public java.net.URL generateUrl(java.lang.String subserver,
                       int zoom,
                       int x,
                       int y)
                         throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Generates an URL by replacing the parameters in the syntax used for this style. This URL can be used for retrieving an image described by x, y and z. These parameters are not validated. Note that this method is based on text-replacement and may result in malformed URLs if the parameters passed are not valid.
        Parameters:
        subserver - The host to use. This may may be a subserver such as a.example.com.
        zoom - The zoomlevel to use.
        x - The x-coorinate.
        y - The y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the URL generated by inserting the passed arguments.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - Thrown if any argument x, y or z are malformed such as they falsify the URL inserted at their respective position.

      • getImageSuffix

        public java.lang.String getImageSuffix()
        Returns the suffix of the files specified in the syntax of the style.
        Returns:
        The suffix of the image-files used by this style. If no suffix can be read, an empty string is returned.
